intro: Hesperonia aspera subsp. villosa, commonly known as the hairy hesperonia, is a flowering plant species native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
